content: gauntlet style fingerless gloves i needed a gauntlet style glove for my harley quinn costume and couldn t find any that i loved so i made up my own and fitted it to myself materials needed medium weight yarn i prefer caron simply soft in any color i used red and black for my costume 4 5 mm crochet hook pattern arm 1 chain 31 2 single_crochet in second chain from hook and all the way across 30 sts turn chain 1 3 single_crochet across 30 sts turn chain 1 x26 4 fold piece in half and single_crochet up the seam to join and form a tube only single_crochet 20 stitches and leave 10 stitches unjoined this will be the cuff end of the fingerless gloves 5 edge the cuff end of the glove with one row of single_crochet ends up being 50 stitches tie off the yarn hand 6 join yarn at other end of tube hand end 7 stitches away from the center line the line the v part of the cuff is on make sure to pay attention and count 7 stitches to the left for the left hand glove and 7 stitches to the right for the right hand glove and single_crochet 28 stitches around join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet chain 1 turn 7 single_crochet 28 join with a slip_stitch chain 1 turn 8 single_crochet 28 join with a slip_stitch chain 1 turn 9 2sc in first st single_crochet in next 26 sts 2 single_crochet in last stitch join with a slip_stitch chain 1 turn 10 single_crochet 30 stitches around join with a slip_stitch chain 1 turn x3 11 single_crochet 30 stitches around do not join chain 1 turn x7 12 2 sctog single_crochet in next 26 sts 2sctog do not join chain 1 turn 13 28 single_crochet do not join chain 1 turn 14 28 single_crochet join with a slip_stitch chain 1 turn 15 28 2sc join with a slip_stitch chain 1 turn x3 16 28 single_crochet join with a slip_stitch tie off thumb 1 join yarn at any stitch on the thumb hole 2 single_crochet 20 stitches around the thumb hole 3 tie off cuff 1 join yarn at v area of cuff 2 single_crochet 50 stitches around the edge of the cuff join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet 3 chain 1 single_crochet in first stitch half_double_crochet in next 48 sts slip_stitch in last stitch join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet tie off 4 weave in ends special notes you can always add row in the hand area i suggest in the step 15 area if you have longer hands than me and you can always add a couple of row in the arm area i suggest in the step 3 area of the arm if you have wider arms than me just remember to keep track of where you add the stitches because it will change the stitch count in other areas i e
